sentences.english: I will write the Gatha you requested.
sentences.chinese: 我將寫您所提請的普賢大圓滿偈。

sentences.english: The Ket allowed their reindeer to wander during summer and kept them close to camp during winter.
sentences.chinese: 偈人讓馴鹿在夏天遊放，冬天將其留在營地附近。

sentences.english: When Sakka had said this verse, the devas applauded but the asuras were silent.
sentences.chinese: 天帝釋唱此偈時，諸天歡呼，阿修羅默然。

sentences.english: The Therigatha as well as its commentary, take it in the same sense.
sentences.chinese: 長老尼偈和對它的評論，已經把它當作同樣的意思了。

sentences.english: The Ket were a patriarchal society, with women in a secondary role.
sentences.chinese: 偈人是族長社會，女人居次位。

sentences.english: As requested by disciple Jing Xing below, I had composed a new gatha.
sentences.chinese: 應弟子敬行以下之提請，我已作一新偈頌。

sentences.english: Ket were originally divided into two exogamous phratries which exchanged marriage partners.
sentences.chinese: 印八偈人原本分爲兩個交換配偶的異族通婚的氏族。

sentences.english: The Imbat Ket were originally divided into two exogamous phratries which exchanged marriage partners.
sentences.chinese: 印八偈人原本分爲兩個交換配偶的異族通婚的氏族。

sentences.english: Today the Ket live in small, riverside villages and are no longer nomadic.
sentences.chinese: 現今偈人住在河沿岸的一些小村莊，已經不再遊牧。

sentences.english: Disciples Yong Lee and Shu Chan had requested that my wife do calligraphy on this Refuge Gatha.
sentences.chinese: 弟子榮利及淑真曾提請我內人手書此皈依偈。

definition: World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
Huineng (638-713), the Sixth Patriarch of Chan Buddhism
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
Avatamsaka sutra of the Huayan school/also called Buddhavatamsaka-mahavaipulya Sutra, the Flower adornment sutra or the Garland sutra
the Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
incantation (Sanskrit: dharani)/religious chant (promoting virtue and obstructing evil)
so I have heard (idiom)/the beginning clause of Buddha's quotations as recorded by his disciple, Ananda (Buddhism)
